channel.title: Update no longer working
channel.description:
I've been playing my server for awhile (won't go online, -.-) and recently I applied changes to the client.java file but when I sent the in-game command ::update it logged me in/out but my new code hadn't taken effect. Also, on the cmd prompt that the server makes this was displayed:
[code][client-1-bot nub]: playerCommand: update java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1 at java.lang.String.substring(Unknown Source) at java.lang.String.substring(Unknown Source) at client.customCommand(Unknown Source) at client.parseIncomingPackets(Unknown Source) at client.packetProcess(Unknown Source) at client.process(Unknown Source) at PlayerHandler.process(Unknown Source) at server.main(Unknown Source) Server [fatal] - exception[/code]
Command in Client file: [code] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("update")) { PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = (Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7)) + 1); PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false; PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true; PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis(); }[/code]
btw, "::update 60" doesn't work either. Do I have to re-code it or is it something in another file?

item.title: Update no longer working
item.dc:creator: @Ps2_Jake Ps2 Jake
item.description:
@Ps2_Jake wrote:

But I changed it to the code that cocoa provided. Or have you read the entire conversation so far?

Read full topic

item.title: Update no longer working
item.dc:creator: @teh_codex teh_codex
item.description:
@teh_codex wrote:

you obviously have hit the wrong button and deleted the command or apart of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Update no longer working
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

It won’t auto-log you back in. After the time runs out, it expects you to compile and restart the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Update no longer working
item.dc:creator: @Ps2_Jake Ps2 Jake
item.description:
@Ps2_Jake wrote:

Not sure, i looked like it worked though. I typed “::update 5” and on the corner of the screen the system update notification came up. It turned off the server but it didn’t autolog me back in.

Read full topic

item.title: Update no longer working
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

Doesn’t the -1 part of the error mean you didn’t input how long you want the update to run for, or you have it to check at a space that you didn’t type. Like its trying to read : ::update10, but you type ::update 10. Maybe?

Read full topic

item.title: Update no longer working
item.dc:creator: @Ps2_Jake Ps2 Jake
item.description:
@Ps2_Jake wrote:

It works! But…It doesn’t autolog me back on. Or is it supposed to?
:

bot nub is signing onto server. [client-1-bot nub]: bot nub refused - update is running ! Did not save for bot nub And whats this?

Read full topic

item.title: Update no longer working
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[code] if ((playerRights >= 2) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Butter”)) {

		if (command.startsWith("update") && command.length() > 7) {
			PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = (Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7)) + 1);
			PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;
			PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
			PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
		}

}
[/code]

lil quick update command i made. It should work

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ps2_Jake wrote:

Project-(something) made by xerozcheese. I think…

item.title: Update no longer working
item.dc:creator: @Ps2_Jake Ps2 Jake
item.description:
@Ps2_Jake wrote:

I’ve been playing my server for awhile (won’t go online, -.-) and recently I applied changes to the client.java file
but when I sent the in-game command ::update it logged me in/out but my new code hadn’t taken effect. Also,
on the cmd prompt that the server makes this was displayed:

[client-1-bot nub]: playerCommand: update java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1 at java.lang.String.substring(Unknown Source) at java.lang.String.substring(Unknown Source) at client.customCommand(Unknown Source) at client.parseIncomingPackets(Unknown Source) at client.packetProcess(Unknown Source) at client.process(Unknown Source) at PlayerHandler.process(Unknown Source) at server.main(Unknown Source) Server [fatal] - exception

Command in Client file:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("update")) { PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = (Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7)) + 1); PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false; PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true; PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis(); }

btw, “::update 60” doesn’t work either.
Do I have to re-code it or is it something in another file?

Read full topic
